Description

Performs routine tasks and structured work assignments related to the execution of clinical studies. Collaborates with multiple clinical study teams to support activities using standard operating procedures and best business practice. Supports multiple projects common deliverables to provide consistent quality to invoices, sample procurement and storage, and other clinical tasks as assigned by the manager of clinical affairs.Responsibilities:•Assist in the execution of clinical studies ensuring that deliverables are completed on time and within budget•Create and manage reports that detail the clinical study progress such as subject screening and enrollment, data collection, documentation of key deliverables, and payments•Assist with the development and management of study-related documents and materials such as investigational plans, case report forms, study manuals, monitoring plan, informed consent forms, and other study related tools•May assist with review of site qualification and activation documentation•Assist in planning, preparing, and shipping materials for study activities•Assist with vendor management to ensure that deliverables are completed on-time, including sample procurement and catalog maintenance•Participate in regular project team meetings •Assist with basic remote data monitoring to ensure accuracy of data collected.•Process incoming study invoices into business system to ensure vendors are paid in a timely manner.•Prioritize work assignments in alignment with clinical affairs and business unit priorities



Qualifications

•Bachelors degree with 0-2 years experience in clinical research, higher education a plus•Basic knowledge of scientific principles and willingness to learn within a highly regulated industry•Experience in IVD or other medical product development a plus•Competency within Microsoft Office systems, advanced skills a plus•Familiarity with disease states and therapeutic approaches a plus•Able to apply analytical skills and sound judgment to develop practical and consistent solutions to a wide range of problems.•Must be detail-oriented, demonstrate excellent verbal/written communication skills and interpersonal skills•Able to travel occasionally up to 10%, to support and participate in clinical affairs events Danaher Corporation OverviewDanaher is a global science & technology innovator committed to helping our customers solve complex challenges and improve quality of life worldwide.
